summary: This document is an email chain from March 17, 2020, between FBI and DOJ officials regarding attempts to contact a witness, Ms. [Redacted], who claims to have information on the Epstein matter. The correspondence shows coordination between the FBI's Criminal Investigative Division and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General to facilitate contact with this individual.

persons.name: Ms. [Redacted]
persons.context: An individual who has contacted the DOJ leadership multiple times claiming to have information on the Epstein matter, but has not responded to follow-up attempts.

events.title: DOJ/FBI Coordination to Contact Witness
events.description: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General requests the FBI to contact Ms. [Redacted], who claims to have information on the Epstein case, and to confirm once contact is made.

keyFacts: A witness, Ms. [Redacted], contacted DOJ leadership claiming to have information on the Epstein matter.
This was not the first time Ms. [Redacted] had reached out directly to DOJ leadership with purported information.
Previous attempts by a DOJ official to contact Ms. [Redacted] were unsuccessful as she did not return calls or emails.
The Office of the Deputy Attorney General specifically requested the FBI to reach out to Ms. [Redacted] directly.
An initial attempt by the FBI to contact Ms. [Redacted] on March 17, 2020, was unsuccessful as there was no answer and her voicemail was full.
